hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ismail ibn Abi Khalid: I saw upon Shurayh a striped silk cloak and a silk hood. And through another chain, Wakee' from al-A'mash from Abu al-Duha said: I saw Shurayh prostrating in his hood. And through another chain, Ubaidullah ibn Musa from al-A'mash from Abu al-Duha from Shurayh: that he used to pray in a coat without extending his hands from it. And through another chain, Abu Mu'awiyah al-Darir and Ya'la ibn Ubayd from al-A'mash from Muslim said: I saw Shurayh prostrating with his hood, its surplus having come between his forehead and the ground. And through another chain, Wakee', Wahb ibn Jarir, al-Fadl ibn Dukain, and Hisham Abu al-Walid al-Tiyalisi from Shu'bah from al-Hakam said: I saw Shurayh praying in his hood. And through another chain, Ismail ibn Ibrahim al-Asadi from Khalid al-Hadhdha' from Abu al-Duha said: I saw Shurayh prostrating while the turban and hood were upon him. And through another chain, Ubaidullah ibn Musa from Isra'il from Abu Ishaq from Shurayh: that he had a hood of grey silk.

hadiths.text_ar: بَقِيَّةُ طَبَقَةِ مَنْ رَوَى عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ الْخَطَّابِ رَضِيَ اللَّهُ تَعَالَى عنه
hadiths.english_translation: Remaining section of the generation of those who narrated from Umar ibn al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him).
al-Sabi ibn Mu'abbad al-Juhani.
